entries.title: Fix chart colors and follow-up suggestions
entries.desc: Reordered chart color palette so pie chart slices are maximally distinct (teal, coral, blue, orange, purple) instead of all green shades. Fixed SSE parser bug where chunked responses could lose event type. Added Invest Insight tools to follow-up map and default fallback so suggestions always appear.

entries.title: Fix browser password autofill on chat input
entries.desc: Added autocomplete="off" to the chat input and all password fields to prevent Chrome from suggesting saved passwords in the message box.

entries.title: Edit backend connections
entries.desc: Added pencil icon edit button to backend connection cards. Clicking opens the modal pre-filled with current URL and provider. Credentials are optional on edit — only sent if changed. Uses PUT endpoint for updates.

entries.title: Invest Insight as third backend provider
entries.desc: Full Invest Insight integration: InvestInsightProvider maps real estate properties to Ghostfolio-compatible holdings (REAL_ESTATE asset class). Three new tools: invest_insight_properties (CRUD), invest_insight_search (market saturation analysis), invest_insight_demographics (zip code data). Provider factory, guardrails, and verification updated. Total tools: 14.

entries.title: User Settings page with 4 tabs
entries.desc: New Settings overlay accessible from profile dropdown with Profile (display name, account info), Backends (full CRUD with card layout), Display (4 rendering toggles), and Import (portfolio drag-and-drop upload) tabs. Admin panel reduced from 7 to 5 tabs.

entries.title: Automated changelog from git history
entries.desc: Changelog externalized from hardcoded JavaScript to static/changelog.json. Generation script merges git log with curated overrides. 56 entries with commit hashes and rich descriptions. CI verifies the script runs successfully.

entries.title: Combined portfolio provider
entries.desc: When multiple backends are active, data is merged automatically. Holdings are concatenated with allocations recomputed to 100%, activities merged and sorted by date. If one backend fails, the other still works (graceful degradation). UI badge shows active backend names.

entries.title: Rotki provider implementation
entries.desc: Full Rotki backend support: session-based auth, async task polling, crypto balance normalization, event-to-order mapping, exchange and blockchain account listing. Methods Rotki doesn't support return valid empty structures so tools handle them gracefully.

entries.title: Add Backend modal (Ghostfolio + Rotki)
entries.desc: Modal form to add new backend connections with provider dropdown, label, base URL, and provider-specific credential fields. Ghostfolio uses security token, Rotki uses username/password. Dynamic field visibility based on provider selection.

entries.title: Profile dropdown with backend management
entries.desc: Account badge is now a profile dropdown with display name, user ID, connected backends list with active/inactive toggles, test connection button, and add/remove backends. Sign-out button moved to dropdown footer.

entries.title: Auto-register Ghostfolio on login
entries.desc: When logging in with a Ghostfolio security token, the system automatically creates a backend connection record if none exists. Existing users transition seamlessly with zero disruption.

entries.title: Provider factory for backend connections
entries.desc: Factory function builds the right PortfolioProvider from a DB connection record. For Ghostfolio: exchanges security token for JWT. For Rotki: creates authenticated session. Supports dynamic provider resolution at runtime.

entries.title: Backend connections DB table and CRUD API
entries.desc: New agent_backend_connections table stores per-user backend configs (provider, URL, credentials, active status). REST API: GET/POST/PUT/DELETE /backends plus POST /backends/{id}/test for connectivity checks. Credentials redacted in list responses.

entries.title: All 11 tools accept abstract provider type
entries.desc: Every tool's execute() function now accepts PortfolioProvider instead of GhostfolioClient. Method calls unchanged — zero behavioral change, but any backend can now plug in.

entries.title: GhostfolioClient extends PortfolioProvider ABC
entries.desc: GhostfolioClient now implements the abstract base class. Constructor changed from (token) to (base_url, token) for explicit URL configuration. Added provider_name property.

entries.title: PortfolioProvider abstract base class
entries.desc: Introduced PortfolioProvider ABC with 13 methods defining the contract all backends must implement. Covers portfolio reads, market data, and optional write operations. Each method's docstring specifies the exact return shape.

entries.title: README rewrite for multi-backend
entries.desc: README rewritten as "AI portfolio agent for Ghostfolio, Rotki, and more" with Supported Backends table, architecture diagram, and contributing guide link.

entries.title: MIT license and CONTRIBUTING.md
entries.desc: Added MIT license for open-source distribution. CONTRIBUTING.md includes dev setup, PR guidelines, code style (ruff, async-first), and step-by-step guide for adding a new backend provider.

entries.title: Tool execute and SDK registry tests
entries.desc: Added unit tests for tool execute functions and SDK registry to improve CI coverage. Tests verify tool schemas, parameter validation, and SDK provider switching.

entries.title: Auth, client, and admin model tests
entries.desc: Added tests for JWT auth helpers, GhostfolioClient constructor and API methods, and admin endpoint request/response models. Fade-in animation CSS for smoother loading states.

entries.title: Portfolio Import with file parsing and rollback
entries.desc: Full portfolio import: drag-and-drop file upload, multi-format parser (Interactive Brokers, Trading 212, Degiro, Robinhood, Ghostfolio JSON/CSV), preview table, import confirmation, and rollback capability. Upload history with status badges.

entries.title: Animated ghost loaders
entries.desc: Animated bouncing ghost SVG replaces plain "Loading..." text in the Analytics and Cost Analysis admin tabs. Consistent visual feedback while data loads.

entries.title: Agent Feedback admin tab
entries.desc: Dedicated Feedback tab with KPI cards (total, thumbs up/down, satisfaction rate), daily stacked bar chart, per-conversation breakdown table with titles, thumbs-down detail view, and recent feedback log.

entries.title: Guardrail follow-up suggestions
entries.desc: When guardrails activate (jailbreak attempts, off-topic questions), the follow-up bar now shows generic starter questions ("What does my portfolio look like?") instead of blank or irrelevant suggestions.

entries.title: Agent service unit tests
entries.desc: Added comprehensive tests for agent_service.py covering chat flow, streaming, conversation CRUD, guardrail integration, and tool execution. Restored 35% coverage threshold.

entries.title: Conversation deduplication admin tools
entries.desc: Admin endpoints for diagnosing and cleaning up duplicate conversations caused by eval snapshot runs. GET /admin/conversations/stats shows counts, POST /admin/conversations/deduplicate removes duplicates keeping the most recent per title.

entries.title: Tool calls and verification visibility fix
entries.desc: Fixed tool calls and verification badges not showing in chat. Persist follow-up suggestions across conversation reload. Improved feedback button spacing and alignment.

entries.title: UX polish: typewriter, feedback, contextual follow-ups
entries.desc: Response text now types out with a typewriter effect (~1.2s). Feedback buttons change state (thumbs up -> "Thank you", thumbs down -> "Help us improve"). Submit actually saves and dismisses. Follow-up suggestions are now AI-generated and contextually relevant to the conversation. Fixed duplicate progress step and feedback submit bug.

entries.title: SSE streaming with progressive disclosure
entries.desc: Chat responses now stream via Server-Sent Events. Tool calls appear as progress steps in real-time (starting -> done) before the final response renders. Cache-Control and X-Accel-Buffering headers prevent proxy buffering.

entries.title: Username display names
entries.desc: Users can set a display name from the profile area. Usernames appear in the chat header and are stored in Postgres via agent_user_profiles table.

entries.title: GitHub Actions CI pipeline
entries.desc: Automated CI workflow runs ruff linting and the full pytest suite on every push and pull request.

entries.title: No-cache headers for static HTML
entries.desc: Added Cache-Control no-cache headers to prevent browsers from serving stale versions of the chat UI after deploys.

entries.title: Market data search fix
entries.desc: Fixed market_data tool failing on search queries. Now properly handles the Ghostfolio search API response format and falls back gracefully when symbols are not found.

entries.title: Historical stock price data
entries.desc: New stock_history tool lets the agent show price trends over time (1m, 3m, 6m, 1y, 3y, 5y, max). Returns sampled data points with summary stats (change %, high, low). Works for any stock, ETF, or crypto.

entries.title: Deduplicated tool badges
entries.desc: Fixed "Tools used" display showing the same tool name multiple times when it was called repeatedly (e.g., market_data x3). Now shows each unique tool name once.

entries.title: Account indicator
entries.desc: Header now shows which account is signed in -- "Demo (Grader)" badge for the demo account or "Account xxxxxxxx" with a short user ID for regular users. Persists across page refreshes.

entries.title: Grader quick sign-in
entries.desc: One-click "Quick Sign-in for Grading" button on login page. Pre-seeded demo account with 5 years of diversified portfolio history across 15 symbols (90 transactions including buys and sells).

entries.title: Test suite (256 tests)
entries.desc: Comprehensive test suite: 93 guardrail tests (injection, profanity, encoding, multilingual), 24 verification tests, 124 tool schema tests, 17 API integration tests. Ruff linting, pytest-cov coverage.

entries.title: Categorized welcome suggestions
entries.desc: Welcome screen suggestions organized into 7 tabs: All, Portfolio, Performance, Tax, Risk, Income, Accounts. First two in "All" are single-tool queries, next two are multi-tool for demonstrating agentic behavior.

entries.title: Suggested follow-ups
entries.desc: After each assistant response, a bar of 2-3 contextual follow-up questions appears above the input. Suggestions are based on which tools were called (e.g., portfolio queries suggest risk and tax follow-ups).

entries.title: Verification fix and confidence boost
entries.desc: Fixed performance_data_valid check that was looking for wrong keys in the tool response. Performance queries now correctly verify and show 95%+ confidence instead of failing at 68%.

entries.title: Header cleanup
entries.desc: Removed redundant "AI Financial Assistant" subtitle and "LITELLM (UNIVERSAL)" SDK badge from header. Cleaner look -- SDK info lives in the admin panel where it belongs.

entries.title: Eval history persistence
entries.desc: Eval results now saved to Postgres across deploys. Collapsible history table in admin Evaluations tab shows date, model, pass rates.

entries.title: Inline charting
entries.desc: Chart.js integration renders pie, bar, line, and doughnut charts inline in chat messages. The agent automatically suggests charts when data benefits from visualization.

entries.title: Financial disclaimer and first-login agreement
entries.desc: Full US-focused financial disclaimer citing SEC, FINRA, and IAA 1940. First-time users must accept before using the app. Accessible anytime via the help menu.

entries.title: Discover Features and sign out
entries.desc: New help menu options: Discover Features shows 10 upcoming Ghostfolio integrations (FIRE calculator, benchmarks, watchlist, etc.) with Coming Soon badges. Sign out button added to sidebar.

entries.title: Profanity filter and security docs
entries.desc: Profanity detection with leetspeak variant handling added to guardrails. SECURITY.md and EVAL_RESULTS.md published with links from README.

entries.title: Changelog and help menu
entries.desc: Added a floating help button with project changelog showing all milestones from both the Ghostfolio integration and the standalone agent, with direct links to code changes.

entries.title: Jailbreak and prompt injection defenses
entries.desc: Defense-in-depth guardrails: Unicode normalization, base64 payload scanning, ChatML/Llama delimiter detection, DAN/developer mode blocking, multilingual injection detection (6 languages), credential leak prevention, and harmful financial advice filtering.

entries.title: Help button and model descriptions
entries.desc: Moved help button to sidebar. Expanded changelog to 12 milestones. Added model descriptions and dropdown arrows to SDK selector.

entries.title: Persistent data storage
entries.desc: Migrated conversations, feedback, and settings from ephemeral file storage to Postgres using asyncpg with connection pooling. Data now survives container redeploys on Railway.

entries.title: 10 portfolio analysis tools
entries.desc: Five new tools added: portfolio performance (returns over time), dividend history (income tracking), X-Ray report (portfolio health check), investment timeline (monthly/yearly amounts), and account overview (balances and platforms). Bringing total to 10 tools.

entries.title: 55 golden evaluation test cases
entries.desc: Comprehensive eval suite: 22 happy path cases covering all 10 tools, 8 tool selection tests, 10 edge cases (empty portfolios, ambiguous queries), 10 adversarial cases (prompt injection, jailbreak attempts), and 5 multi-step reasoning tests.

entries.title: Deterministic verification and confidence scoring
entries.desc: Every agent response runs through data integrity checks (allocation sums, valid prices, no hallucinated tickers) and gets a weighted 0-100 confidence score based on tool success rate, check pass rate, response quality, and data backing.

entries.title: Langfuse analytics and cost projections
entries.desc: Full observability via Langfuse: latency tracking, token usage, cost-per-query metrics, daily trace charts, and production cost projections for 100 to 100k users. Admin panel with Analytics and Cost Analysis tabs.

entries.title: Standalone sidecar agent
entries.desc: Extracted the AI agent from the Ghostfolio NestJS app into a standalone FastAPI Python service. Chat UI, JWT auth, 5 core tools (portfolio summary, market data, transactions, risk, tax), LLM-agnostic SDK system with 4 providers, and guardrails.

entries.title: Docker networking fix
entries.desc: Fixed Docker networking for local development using host.docker.internal to reach Ghostfolio running on the host machine.

entries.title: Agent UI enhancements and eval pipeline
entries.desc: Redesigned agent chat UI with Ghostfolio dark theme, conversation persistence, category filtering, admin panel with SDK switching, and CI workflow for automated evaluation.

entries.title: Langfuse observability integration
entries.desc: Integrated Langfuse tracing into the embedded Ghostfolio agent for LLM call monitoring, latency tracking, and cost analysis during development.

entries.title: Agent MVP with 5 tools
entries.desc: First complete version: portfolio summary, market data lookup, transaction history, risk assessment, and tax estimation tools. Conversation persistence, deterministic verification, and golden set evaluation data.

entries.title: Initial AI agent prototype
entries.desc: First AI agent endpoint added to Ghostfolio with basic chat UI, OpenAI integration, and portfolio summary tool. Proof of concept for the financial assistant concept.
